intro: Campyloneurum filiforme, commonly known as the slender clubmoss, is a species of spore-bearing plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its delicate, thread-like leaves arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces spores in cone-like structures called strobili, which are borne on the upper part of the plant. Campyloneurum filiforme plays a role in maintaining soil stability and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
